slides.title: India - Basic Facts
slides.content:
**Location:** Northern & Eastern Hemisphere

**Area:** 3.287 million km² (7th largest)

**Latitudes:** 8°4'N to 37°6'N
**Longitudes:** 68°7'E to 97°25'E

**Standard Meridian:** 82°30'E (passing through Mirzapur, UP)

**Coastline:** 7,516.6 km

slides.title: Physical Divisions
slides.content:
**1. The Himalayas:** Northern mountain ranges

**2. Northern Plains:** Formed by Ganga-Brahmaputra-Indus

**3. Peninsular Plateau:** Deccan Plateau, oldest landmass

**4. Coastal Plains:** Eastern and Western coasts

**5. Islands:** Andaman & Nicobar, Lakshadweep

slides.title: Major Rivers
slides.content:
**Himalayan Rivers (Perennial):**
- Ganga (2,525 km in India)
- Brahmaputra
- Indus

**Peninsular Rivers (Seasonal):**
- Godavari (longest peninsular river)
- Krishna
- Kaveri
- Narmada
- Tapi

slides.title: Climate
slides.content:
**Type:** Tropical Monsoon Climate

**Seasons:**
1. Winter (Dec-Feb)
2. Summer (Mar-May)
3. Monsoon (Jun-Sep)
4. Post-Monsoon (Oct-Nov)

**Monsoon:** Southwest monsoon brings 75% of annual rainfall

slides.title: States and Capitals
slides.content:
**Total States:** 28
**Union Territories:** 8

**Largest State:** Rajasthan (area)
**Smallest State:** Goa (area)
**Most Populous:** Uttar Pradesh
**Least Populous:** Sikkim

**Highest Literacy:** Kerala
